title.narrative: PLANNING, MONITORING AND EVALUATION

description.narrative: By 2025, UNICEF Somalia staff and partners have enhanced capacity to design, implement and monitor programmes, and as well as generate evidence through research and evaluations, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, UNICEF Somalia staff and partners have enhanced capacity to design, implement and monitor programmes, and as well as generate evidence through research and evaluations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, UNICEF Somalia staff and partners have enhanced capacity to design, implement and monitor programmes, and as well asgenerate evidence through research and evaluations

description.narrative: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) was signed with the Somali National Bureau of Statistics (SNBS) to conduct MICS in 2022 which will enable the Country Office to generate evidence on the status of women and children in Somalia. Programme Cooperation Agreements (PCAs) were signed with 81 Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) during the reporting period.; The new Country Programme Results were finalized and all preparatory works including the uploading of the ;result framework in the UNICEF result planning and reporting platform (Result Assessment Module/RAM) was completed ahead to ensure smooth implementation and monitoring. | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2022
